sentences.en: "Your modesty is a cover for your overweening conceit," she said.
sentences.cn: “你表面谦虚，骨子里目中无人。”她说道。

sentences.en: A fool is wise in his own conceit.
As conceit makes one lag behind, so modesty helps one make progress.
sentences.cn: 骄傲使人落后, 谦虚使人进步.

sentences.en: Conceit and complacency are the archenemy of unity.
sentences.cn: 骄傲自满是团结的大敌.

sentences.en: Conceit comes from shallowness; arrogance is due to ignorance.
sentences.cn: 骄傲来自浅薄, 狂妄出于无知.

sentences.en: Conceit is associated with stupidity and ignorance.
sentences.cn: 骄傲的朋友是愚蠢和无知.

sentences.en: Conceit is the enemy of [ to ] progress.
sentences.cn: 骄傲是进步的 大敌.

sentences.en: Critics may complain that the novel's central conceit is rather simplistic.
sentences.cn: 批评家们可能会认为小说的核心比喻过于简单。

sentences.en: Error is often the precursor of what is correct, but conceit is the prelude to a fall.
sentences.cn: 错误往往是正确的先导, 骄傲是跌跤的前奏.

sentences.en: He is wise in his own conceit.
Pamela knew she was a good student, and that was not just a conceit.
sentences.cn: 帕梅拉知道自己是个好学生，而这绝不仅仅是自负。
罗伊斯表现出自信但不自负。

sentences.en: She seems to be eaten up with her own conceit.
sentences.cn: 她仿佛已经被骄傲冲昏了头脑.

sentences.en: The ill-advised conceit of the guardian angel dooms the film from the start.
sentences.cn: 对守护天使的蹩脚设计弄巧成拙，从一开始就注定这部电影要失败。

sentences.en: There is a savo ( u ) r of conceit in everything he says.
sentences.cn: 他所说的所有的话都有自负的意味.

words.tran_cn: 不切实用的花俏物品,装饰品

trans.tran_cn: 自负，骄傲自大，（文学中）巧妙的比喻
trans.tran_en: an attitude that shows you have too high an opinion of your own abilities or importance
